de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.algorithm.clustering.kmeans

Class KMedoidsPAM<V,D extends NumberDistance<D,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.algorithm.AbstractAlgorithm<R>
      • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.algorithm.AbstractDistanceBasedAlgorithm<V,D,Clustering<MedoidModel>>
        • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.algorithm.clustering.kmeans.KMedoidsPAM<V,D>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - vector datatype
    D - distance value type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Algorithm, ClusteringAlgorithm<Clustering<MedoidModel>>, InspectionUtilFrequentlyScanned, Parameterizable

    @Title(value="Partioning Around Medoids")
@Reference(title="Clustering my means of Medoids",
           authors="Kaufman, L. and Rousseeuw, P.J.",
           booktitle="Statistical Data Analysis Based on the L_1\u2013Norm and Related Methods")
public class KMedoidsPAM<V,D extends NumberDistance<D,?>>
extends AbstractDistanceBasedAlgorithm<V,D,Clustering<MedoidModel>>
implements ClusteringAlgorithm<Clustering<MedoidModel>>
    Provides the k-medoids clustering algorithm, using the "Partitioning Around Medoids" approach. Reference:

    Clustering my means of Medoids
    Kaufman, L. and Rousseeuw, P.J.
    in: Statistical Data Analysis Based on the L_1â€“Norm and Related Methods

      • assignToNearestCluster

        protected boolean assignToNearestCluster(ArrayDBIDs means,
                             DBIDs ids,
                             WritableDoubleDataStore second,
                             List<? extends ModifiableDBIDs> clusters,
                             DistanceQuery<V,D> distQ)
        Returns a list of clusters. The kth cluster contains the ids of those FeatureVectors, that are nearest to the kth mean.
        Parameters:
        means - Object centroids
        ids - Object ids
        second - Distance to second nearest medoid
        clusters - cluster assignment
        distQ - distance query
        Returns:
        true when any object was reassigned
